title: Summoner Name
body: I was wondering if you are allowed to have 'Rito' in your summoner name e.g 'PizzaRitoGuy'

replies.body: my ranked team is called ritogames
i checked with a rioter. if it can be used as a name the it's fine.

I think you are, just not "Riot".

The official placement of the word Riot has to be in the front of the name usually followed by a space then the distinctive name.

> [{quoted}](name=ninjaIRL ,realm=OCE,application-id=hIjvqaz6,discussion-id=wf5cdrU2,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-10-04T06:28:54.123+0000)
>
>The official placement of the word Riot has to be in the front of the name usually followed by a space then the distinctive name.

It actually doesn't matter, "ABC", "A B C", "abc" and "a b c" are the exact same name according to Riot's servers, it's just how they're designed.

Hence for me, there shouldn't be another guy on this server that uses the exact spelling of my name but just in different forms, if anyone tries to make a name of "sekai", "se Kai" or "sEk AI" they would all be rejected.

That's why I would say any name with a "Riot" as the first 4 letters would not be allowed, however any respelling of it should work.
I would be putting the 'Rito' in the middle of two names, so it should be obvious that i'm not with riot?

I doubt it. Thing is, one of the requirements of summoner names is that they don't cause people to think you're associated with Riot if you aren't and "Rito", while not the same as "Riot", could still cause people to think that. After all it's not that uncommon for people to refer to Riot as Rito (as I'm sure you are aware), and someone who reads it fast might read it as "Riot" because that's what they're used to seeing (this actually happened to me once, and I did report them for their name knowing it was spelt "Rito").
